-- TODO: This holds more generally for idempotent adjunctions, not just reflective adjunctions.
/-- For a reflective functor `i` (with left adjoint `L`), with unit `Î·`, we have `Î·_iL = iL Î·`.
-/
theorem unit_obj_eq_map_unit [reflective i] (X : C) :
    (of_right_adjoint i).unit.app (i.obj ((left_adjoint i).obj X)) =
      i.map ((left_adjoint i).map ((of_right_adjoint i).unit.app X)) :=
  by
  rw [â† cancel_mono (i.map ((of_right_adjoint i).counit.app ((left_adjoint i).obj X))), â† i.map_comp]
  simp
#align unit_obj_eq_map_unit unit_obj_eq_map_unit
unit_is_iso:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `Â«expr â‰« Â» -/

/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `Â«expr â‹™ Â» -/
/-- If `A` is essentially in the image of a reflective functor `i`, then `Î·_A` is an isomorphism.
This gives that the "witness" for `A` being in the essential image can instead be given as the
reflection of `A`, with the isomorphism as `Î·_A`.

(For any `B` in the reflective subcategory, we automatically have that `Îµ_B` is an iso.)
-/
theorem functor.ess_image.unit_is_iso [reflective i] {A : C} (h : A âˆˆ i.ess_image) :
    IsIso ((of_right_adjoint i).unit.app A) :=
  by
  suffices
    (of_right_adjoint i).unit.app A =
      Â«expr â‰« Â» h.get_iso.inv
        (Â«expr â‰« Â» ((of_right_adjoint i).unit.app (i.obj h.witness)) ((Â«expr â‹™ Â» (left_adjoint i) i).map h.get_iso.hom))
    by
    rw [this]
    infer_instance
  rw [â† nat_trans.naturality]
  simp
#align functor.ess_image.unit_is_iso functor.ess_image.unit_is_iso

/-- If `Î·_A` is a split monomorphism, then `A` is in the reflective subcategory. -/
theorem mem_ess_image_of_unit_is_split_mono [reflective i] {A : C} [is_split_mono ((of_right_adjoint i).unit.app A)] :
    A âˆˆ i.ess_image :=
  by
  let Î· : Â«expr âŸ¶ Â» ((Â«exprğŸ­Â») C) (Â«expr â‹™ Â» (left_adjoint i) i) := (of_right_adjoint i).unit
  haveI : is_iso (Î·.app (i.obj ((left_adjoint i).obj A))) := (i.obj_mem_ess_image _).unit_is_iso
  have : epi (Î·.app A) := by
    apply epi_of_epi (retraction (Î·.app A)) _
    rw [show Â«expr â‰« Â» (retraction _) (Î·.app A) = _ from Î·.naturality (retraction (Î·.app A))]
    apply epi_comp (Î·.app (i.obj ((left_adjoint i).obj A)))
  skip
  haveI := is_iso_of_epi_of_is_split_mono (Î·.app A)
  exact mem_ess_image_of_unit_is_iso A
#align mem_ess_image_of_unit_is_split_mono mem_ess_image_of_unit_is_split_mono
